lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This is the Duke class that interacts with users using inputs from users in CLI.
* The following are private class fields of a Duke instance.
* This is the Constructor of Duke.
* This is the main point of interaction of user and duke.Duke.
* This is a Parser class that deals with making sense of the user command.
* Returns a Command instance based on the input String from the user.
* @param command A String representing the command and details keyed in by the user.
* @return  A Command object that when its execute() method is called, make changes to the tasks list or Duke.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException An exception thrown when no description follows a recognizable command.
* @throws UnknownCommandException  An exception thrown when the command is not recognizable.
* This is a Storage class that deals with loading tasks
* from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* This is the private class field of a Storage instance.
* This is the constructor for a Storage instance.
* @param filePath   A string representing the filepath in the operating system.
* Returns an Arraylist of Task loaded from the filePath.
* @return An ArrayList of Task that was stored in the file located in the filePath.
* @throws DukeFileException  An exception thrown when there is error reading or creating the file.
//create file if it does not exist
// input received here will definitely be correct and accurate
// either, todo, deadline, delete, event, done
* Appends a line of command into the file located at the filePath.
* @param taskCommand A String representing the input given to the Parser to generate a Task.
* @throws IOException  An exception thrown when FileWriter is unable to find or append to the file at filePath.
public void appendCommand(String taskCommand) throws IOException {
* Overwrites the file located at the filePath with the minimal commands to regenerate the current Task list.
* @param taskList An ArrayList of Task to be saved as text in the file located at filePath.
* @throws IOException An exception thrown when the FileWriter is unable to find or write to the file at filePath.
public void safeFile(ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws IOException {
* This is a TaskList class that contains the task list.
* This is the private class fields of a TaskList instance.
* Adds a task to the current ArrayList of task.
* @param t A task that is created by the user.
* Prints out the contents of all the tasks in the ArrayList of task.
public void printTasks(Ui ui) throws EmptyListException {
* Searches the ArrayList of Task for tasks with the specified keyword and uses an Ui to print it out.
* @param ui An Ui instance that prints the list of task containing the keyword.
* @param keyword A String representing the keyword.
* @throws EmptyListException An exception thrown when the ArrayList of Task is empty.
public void printFindTasks(Ui ui, String keyword) throws EmptyListException, TaskNotFoundException {
* Saves the current ArrayList of task using a Storage instance.
* @param store  A Storage instance that helps to save the task list in a text file.
* @throws DukeFileException An exception thrown when store encounters an error when storing the tasks.
public void safeTasks(Storage store) throws DukeFileException {
* Marks a task in the ArrayList of Task as done.
* @param index  An int representing the index of task to be marked.
* @param store  A Storage instance to save this action into the text file.
* @param ui     An Ui instance that helps to print out the message of this action to the user.
* @throws TaskIsCompleteException An exception thrown when the task to be mark is already done.
* @throws DukeFileException    An exception thrown when the store gets an error from storing the action.
public void markTask(int index, Storage store, Ui ui)
* Deletes a task from the ArrayList of Task.
* @param index An int representing the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param store A Storage instance to save this action into a text file.
* @param ui    An Ui instance to print the message of this action to the user.
* @throws DukeFileException  An exception thrown when the store gets an error from storing the action.
public void deleteTask(int index, Storage store, Ui ui)
* Returns an int representing the number of Task in the list.
* @return An int representing the number of Tasks.
* This is an Ui class that deals with interaction with Users.
* These are class fields and constants of Ui.
* Prints the standard welcome message user sees when initiating duke.
System.out.println("Hello I'm FullOfBugs. What can I do for you?");
* Prints the standard line separator for each message.
* Prints the error message from DukeExceptions.
* @param message A String representing the message to be printed.
* Prints the message when a task is added to the list.
* @param task  A Task instance that contains details of the newly added task and to be printed.
* @param newSize An int representing the new size of the Task list.
public void printAddTask(Task task, int newSize) {
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");
* Prints the message when a task is removed from the list.
* @param task  A Task instance that contains the details of the removed task.
* @param remainingSize An int representing the newly updated size of task list.
public void printRemoveTask(Task task, int remainingSize) {
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task:");
* Prints the message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task A Task instance that contains details of the task marked as done.
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints a list of all the task currently in the list.
* @param tasks A TaskList instance containing a list of task.
* Prints a list of task that contains a specified keyword.
* @param tasks  An ArrayList of task that contains the keyword in its description.
System.out.println("    Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Prints the farewell message when the user says bye to Duke.
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Returns a string representing the command keyed in by the user.
* @return A String representing a single command.
* This is an AddCommand class that extends Command.
* This is the constructor for AddCommand.
* @param taskType A String representing the task to be created.
* @param description A String containing the details of the task to be created.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui)
* This is an abstract Command class.
* These are class fields of a Command instance.
* This is the constructor for a Command instance.
* @param command A String representing the type of command created.
* This is the overloaded constructor for Command instance.
* @param command A String representing the type of command created.
* @param description A String representing the details of the command.
* This is an overloaded constructor for Command instance.
* @param command A String representing the type of command.
* @param index  An int representing an index of the task list.
* This is an abstract method that runs the action as specified by the command.
* @param taskList  A TaskList instance that may store or remove task (if any) by command.
* @param store  A Storage instance that records the task list after executing the command.
* @param ui  An Ui instance that prints the message generated from the action specified by the command.
* @throws DukeException An Exception thrown if Duke gets an Error
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui)
* Returns a boolean indicating if user is exiting Duke.
* @return A boolean representing if the user is exiting Duke.
* This is a DeleteCommand class that extends Command.
* This is the constructor of a DeleteCommand.
* @param index An int representing the index of task to be deleted.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui)

* This is the constructor of a DoneCommand.
* @param index An int representing the index of task to be marked done.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui)
* This is an ExitCommand class that extends Command.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui) throws DukeFileException {
* This is a FindCommand class that extends Command
* This is the class field of a FindCommand
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui) throws EmptyListException, TaskNotFoundException {
* This is a ListCommand class that extends Command.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage store, Ui ui) throws EmptyListException {
* This is a CommandParamException that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when unfitting parameters to a command is provided.
* This is the class field of a CommandParamException instance.
return String.format(" OOPS! I don't think your %s is keyed in correctly.", this.command);
* This is a DukeException class that is thrown when Duke encounters an error.
* This is a DukeFileException class that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when Duke gets an error when trying to access or write to a file.
* This is an EmptyDescriptionException that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when a Command is provided without descriptions.
* This is the class field of EmptyDescriptionException instance.
* @param command A String representing the command provided but without description.
return String.format(" OOPS!!! The description of %s cannot be empty.", this.command);
* This is an EmptyListException class that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when the user wants to see the list when it is empty.
super(" Sorry! The list is empty! ");
* This is a TaskIsCompleteException that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when the user attempts to mark an already complete task as done.
* This is the class field of TaskIsCompleteException.
* @param indexToMark An index representing the index of an already complete task.
return String.format(" OOPS! I think you have already completed task %d !", this.index);
* This is a TaskNotFoundException that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when the task at specified index is not found.
* This is the class field of TaskNotFoundException.
* @param index An index representing the task the user attempts to find, but does not exist.
super(" OOPS!!! There is no such task!");
* This is an Overloaded TaskNotFoundException for no index specified.
super(" OOPS!!! There is no such task!");
+ String.format("\n    I can't seem to find the task at number %d !", this.index);
* This is an UnknownCommandException that extends DukeException.
* This exception is thrown when the user keys in random unrecognized commands.
super(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what you mean ");
* This is a Deadline class that extends Task.
* These are class field of Deadline.
* @param description A String representing the description of the deadline.
* @param by A String representing the date and time of deadline.
* @throws CommandParamException An exception thrown when the date and time is not formatted properly.
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws CommandParamException {
//date should be yyyy-mm-dd, time should be 2359...
* This is an Event class that extends Task.
* These are class field of Event.
* @param description A String representing the description of the event.
* @param at A String representing the date and time of the event.
* @throws CommandParamException An exception thrown when the date and time is not formatted properly.
public Event(String description, String at) throws CommandParamException {
//date should be yyyy-mm-dd, time should be 2359 format
* This is a Task Class that represent the Task user keys into Duke.
* These are class field of a Task.
* @param description A String representing description of task.
* Returns "X" when a task is done and " " when it is not done.
* @return A String representing the completion status of a Task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a boolean indicating if the task is done.
* @return A boolean representing the completion status of the task
* Returns the full command required to create this task.
* @return A String representing the command that created this task.
* This is a ToDo class that extends Task.
* @param description A String representing the details of the ToDo task.
* This class test the construction of DukeExceptions.
assertEquals(" OOPS! I don't think your deadline is keyed in correctly.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS! I don't think your event is keyed in correctly.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! Error loading file!!", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! The description of todo cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! The description of deadline cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! The description of event cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! The description of delete cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! The description of done cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" Sorry! The list is empty! ", e.getMessage());
assertEquals(" OOPS! I think you have already completed task 123 !", e.getMessage());
String expectedMessage = " OOPS!!! There is no such task!"
+ "\n    I can't seem to find the task at number 123 !";
assertEquals(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what you mean ", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("todo go jogging", new ToDo("go jogging").fullCommand());
